intro: Cochlioda, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Cochlioda species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking appearance and hardy nature.
